author: Emma Munbodh
title: British Airways launch Take Off sale : here's our pick of the best packages
text:
British Airways has created what is believed to be the world’s biggest piece of money art, using a combination of ten, five, two and one penny coins to celebrate its latest 'British Airways Take Off' sale on flights worldwide.
Six hundred thousand coins were delivered from a London bank vault to the airline’s Heathrow engineering base this week, and a small team created a giant mural on an aircraft hangar floor depicting the Statue of Liberty in New York - British Airways’ flagship Atlantic route.
The handmade artwork took over six hours to create, and weighed in at a whopping 2,725kg.
Sara Dunham, British Airways’ head of marketing, retail and direct, said: “We’ve decided to re-create an iconic image from one of our most popular destinations to celebrate the ‘Big British Airways Take Off’ this week.
"We offer a great range of fares and holiday packages, which will allow our customers to bank plenty of money to spend on their holidays”.

Barbados: Seven nights at the 3* Dover Beach Hotel, from £499 per person , travelling between May 2 and June 24. Includes World Traveller return flights from Gatwick and accommodation.
Mauritius: Seven nights at the 3* Coin De Mire Attitude, from £819 per person , travelling between June 1 and June 23. Includes World Traveller return flights from Gatwick and accommodation with breakfast.
Dubai: Three nights at the 4* Doubletree by Hilton Ras Al Khaimah, from £399 per person , travelling between May 8 and June 30. Includes World Traveller return flights from Heathrow and accommodation with breakfast.
St Lucia: Seven nights at the 3* Bay Gardens Inn, from £599 per person , travelling between June 1 and June 24. Includes World Traveller return flights from Gatwick and accommodation.
Customers can book online at www.ba.com . British Airways flights include free online check-in and in-flight refreshments.
